category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
I acknowledge and admit that everything comes from You—
life, breath, happiness, success,
my senses, goodness, truth, beauty—
everything that makes life good.
In my spiritual life, too, I am completely dependent on You.

Give me the grace to see how much I need Your grace.
Show me my sinfulness so I will willingly confess it.
Reveal my weakness to me so I can find my strength in You.

I thank You for any sign of sorrow for my sin; please give me more of it.
My sins are dark and deep, and they come from a heart that is hard, proud, and self-righteous.
Help me to confess them with sadness, regret, and a hatred for my sin,
without making excuses or pretending I've earned anything.

I need healing.
Good Physician, here is a perfect opportunity for You; come and show Your power.
I need faith.
You're the one who gave it to me, so please maintain it, strengthen it, and increase it.
Center it on the work of the Savior, on the majesty of the Father, and on the work of the Spirit.
Work this in me now so that I may never doubt that You are a truthful, mighty, and faithful God.

Then I can bring my heart to You, full of love, gratitude, hope, and joy.
May I lay at Your feet these good things that were grown in Your own garden.
May I love you with a passion that never cools,
believe in you with a confidence that never wavers,
hope in you with an expectation that never fades,
delight in you with a joy that can't be silenced,
and glorify you with all of my strength—
burning, blazing, glowing, and shining as a reflection of Your own glory.
